explain_money: I split the amount evenly because I think it is only fair that we get the same amount. I would want someone to share the $10 with me so it is only fair that I also split the money.
I split the money evenly because this was the most fair way of doing things. I would feel guilty if I more money than my partner.
I think it is fair that if we both want it, we should split it 50/50. It makes it easy and there are no that should be involved.
Why I allocated the $10 into $5 each is because I feel like it is the fairest. We both would get equal amounts so there is o unfairness.
Similarly, I would guess that the other participant would want the money just as much as I would. We can split it down the middle and each get rewarded equally.
We are partners and I don't think it would be fair or kind to give either of us more than the other, we are equals and should treat each other as such.

I do not know this individual, but this monetary compensation should be as fair as possible. With that being said, I am a senior and I believe I deserve $6 (compared to $5) because of seniority and grown-up tasks I complete on my own at my own expense.
I again, thought it was fair to divide evenly amongst us to we had the same amount.
i spoke to her right before the study. she seemed kind, i don't know her financial situation, and i don't want to be a greedy person and take resources all for myself

For the money, I think the more you get, the more value it has. I would be more likely to use $10 on something I actually needed or wanted than with $5. Overall, it makes more sense to have one person get all the money than splitting since the full amount is low.
I feel like it is most fair to split it up 50/50. Especially is we were both offered it, it would feel stingy to take it all.
I do not know the person i was paired with and i thought it would be fair to split the ten dollars because we are partners for this study. it doesnt seem fair to take more or all the money.

I gave half to my partner because honestly if they know that this is the options we had (to give them some or to not), then I would probably give them half just because its 5 bucks and I do not want to come off as rude.
Ten dollars really is not that much money and if we split it, that would be a win-win for both of us. I am not too concerned with the tradeoff of the other $5.

In this section I once again divided the total evenly, giving myself $5 and giving my partner $5. My reasoning is the same as with the minutes off from above, I don't think it is fair to divide the total any other way in a situation with such little rules and stipulations.
I feel like we both need money equally; I don't know the financial situation he is in, so why would I deserve more.
I split the $10 even ($5 and $5), because we could both benefit from the money. Plus, I don't know how we could spend it, because there are many different ways to, so it is easiest to just split.
